info.title: Gisgraphy webservices
info.description:
Since 2006, [Gisgraphy](http://www.gisgraphy.com) is a free, open source framework that offers the possibility to do geolocalisation and geocoding via Java APIs or REST webservices. Because geocoding is nothing without data, it provides an easy to use importer that will automatically download and import the necessary (free) data to your local database ([OpenStreetMap](http://www.openstreetmap.org/), [Geonames](http://www.geonames.org/) and [Quattroshapes](http://www.quattroshapes.com/): more than 100 million entries). You can also add your own data with the Web interface or the importer connectors provided. Gisgraphy is production ready, and has been designed to be scalable(load balanced), performant and used in other languages than just java : results can be output in XML, JSON, PHP, Python, Ruby, YAML, GeoRSS, and Atom. One of the most popular GPS tracking System (OpenGTS) also includes a Gisgraphy client...Gisgraphy is a framework. As a result it's flexible and powerful enough to be used in a lot of different use cases. [read more](http://www.gisgraphy.com)


if you use the premium servers, you can use the api key to test the webservices

get.summary: split a raw address into several parts
get.description: The address parser and address standardizer, are part of the Gisgraphy project (free open source worldwide geocoder). Address parsing is the process of dividing a single address string into its individual component parts. Please visit [http://www.address-parser.net](http://www.address-parser.net) for more details

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: A postal address.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The ISO 3166 Alpha 2 code of the country.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback method name (optional), use to wrap the content into a (alphanumeric) Javascript method. Works only for script output formats (JSON, PHP, Ruby, Python)

parameters.name: indent
parameters.description: indents the results.Default to false. Possible values are true or false (or on when used with the rest service. If you use a checkbox in a web form, to indent the results, the value will be 'on' or 'off', so for a simple use : the value of indent can be 'true' or 'on'

parameters.name: standardize
parameters.description: Whether the address should be standardized after parsing, the value will be 'on' or 'off', so for a simple use : the value of indent can be 'true' or 'on'

parameters.name: geocode
parameters.description: UNUSED YET. Whether the address should be geocoded after parsing, the value will be 'on' or 'off', so for a simple use : the value of indent can be 'true' or 'on'

401.description: Need auth. The API key parameter is missing or wrong, or doesn't correspond to any subscriptions

403.description: Unhauthorize (auth will change nothing).Your IP is not allowed.

412.description: Missing parameter. Some parameters required for the webservices ar missing, please consult documentation

429.description: Too many requests. You exceed the authorized rate

get.summary: search for places by text around a GPS point
get.description: The full text service allows you to search for features / places / street and do autocompletion . you can : Specify one or more words search on part of the name (auto completion / suggestion) Search for text or zip code Specify a GPS restriction (promote nearest, not sorted but has an impact on the score), Limit the results to a specific Language, Country, place type, Paginate the results, Specify the output verbosity, Tells if you want the output to be indented, Tells that all words are required or not, The search is case insensitive, use synonyms (Saint/st, ..), separator characters stripping, ...

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The searched text : The text for the query can be a zip code, a string or one or more strings

parameters.name: allwordsrequired
parameters.description: Whether the fulltext engine should considers all the words specified as required. Defaults to false (since v 4.0). possible values are true|false (or 'on' when used with the rest service)

parameters.name: spellchecking
parameters.description: The spellchecking (optional) : whether some suggestions should be provided if no results are found

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: The latitude (north-south) for the location point to search around. The value is a floating number, between -90 and +90. It uses GPS coordinates

parameters.name: lng
parameters.description: TThe longitude (east-West) for the location point to search around. The value is a floating number between -180 and +180. It uses GPS coordinates.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: distance from the location point in meters we'd like to search around. The value is a number > 0 if it is not specify or incorrect.

parameters.name: suggest
parameters.description: If this parameter is set then it will search in part of the names of the street, place,.... It allow you to do auto completion auto suggestion. See the Gisgraphy leaflet plugin for more details. The JSON format will be forced if this parameter is true. See auto completion / suggestions engine for more details

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: The output style verbosity (optional) : Determines the output verbosity. 4 styles are available

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: limit the search to the specified ISO 3166 country code. Default : search in all countries

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The language code (optional) : The iso 639 Alpha2 or alpha3 Language Code. Some properties such as the AlternateName AdmNames and countryname belong to a certain language code. The language parameter can limit the output of those fields to a certain language (it only apply when style parameter='style') : If the language code does not exists or is not specified, properties with all the languages are retrieved If it exists, the properties with the specified language code, are retrieved

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first pagination index. Numbered from 1. If the number is < 1 or not specified, it will be set to the default value : 1

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The last pagination index. if < 1 or not specified, it will be set to startindex + 10. Max = 10 (can be changed)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback method name (optional), use to wrap the content into a (alphanumeric) Javascript method. Works only for script output formats (JSON, PHP, Ruby, Python)

parameters.name: indent
parameters.description: indents the results.Default to false. Possible values are true or false (or on when used with the rest service. If you use a checkbox in a web form, to indent the results, the value will be 'on' or 'off', so for a simple use : the value of indent can be 'true' or 'on'

get.description: The Gisgraphy geocoding service allows you to transform postal addresses or other descriptions (a street, a city, a postal code, a country, or a combination) of a location into a (latitude, longitude) coordinate.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: A postal address, structured or not, a street, a city, a postal code, a country, or a combination.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country where the place/address is. It is used to determine the postal address format and to improve performance. It will probably be optional in next version to ease the usability. The value must be the ISO 3166 Alpha 2 code of the country.

parameters.name: postal
parameters.description: Whether the given address is a postal address. default to false. In other words, if the address follow the specification or if it is a well-formed address as it was written on an envelope. This parameter will enable the parsing of the address by the address parser before geocoding, this way, the relevance will be better because because if parsing is successful, we will know the meaning of each word. Note that you can also specify each field if you already know them.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first pagination index. Numbered from 1. If the number is < 1 or not specified, it will be set to the default value : 1

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The last pagination index. if < 1 or not specified, it will be set to startindex + 10. Max = 10 (can be changed)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback method name (optional), use to wrap the content into a (alphanumeric) Javascript method. Works only for script output formats (JSON, PHP, Ruby, Python)

parameters.name: indent
parameters.description: indents the results. Possible values are true or false (or on when used with the rest service. If you use a checkbox in a web form, to indent the results, the value will be 'on' or 'off', so for a simple use : the value of indent can be 'true' or 'on'

get.description: The geolocalisation service allows to search for features around a earth location. you can Specify GPS position, Limit the results to a specific place type (e.g : search all monuments around a point), Limit the results to a specified radius, Paginate the results, Tells if you want the output to be indented (currently, applies only for XML, not JSON for performance reasons. May change in next version)

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: The latitude (north-south) for the location point to search around. The value is a floating number, between -90 and +90. It uses GPS coordinates

parameters.name: lng
parameters.description: TThe longitude (east-West) for the location point to search around. The value is a floating number between -180 and +180. It uses GPS coordinates.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: distance from the location point in meters we'd like to search around. The value is a number > 0 if it is not specify or incorrect.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: Whether (or not) we want the distance field to be output. This option is useful to improve the performance if we don't care about the distance (e.g : we search for name). Of course, the results won't be sorted by distance. If you use a checkbox in a form to indent the results, the value will be 'on' or 'off', so to simplify the use : the value for the web service can be 'true' or 'on'

parameters.name: placetype
parameters.description: filter search for a given placetype

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first pagination index. Numbered from 1. If the number is < 1 or not specified, it will be set to the default value : 1

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The last pagination index. if < 1 or not specified, it will be set to startindex + 10. Max = 10 (can be changed)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback method name (optional), use to wrap the content into a (alphanumeric) Javascript method. Works only for script output formats (JSON, PHP, Ruby, Python)

get.description: The street service allows you to search for street by GPS position. You can : Specify GPS position, Give the beginning or a part of the name of the street (useful for autocompletion), Limit search to a specific type (e.g : Pedestrian, highway, residential, ... 25 types available), Limit search to a specified radius, Limit search to one way streets,

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: The latitude (north-south) for the location point to search around. The value is a floating number, between -90 and +90. It uses GPS coordinates

parameters.name: lng
parameters.description: TThe longitude (east-West) for the location point to search around. The value is a floating number between -180 and +180. It uses GPS coordinates.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: distance from the location point in meters we'd like to search around. The value is a number > 0 if it is not specify or incorrect.

parameters.name: oneway
parameters.description: whether the street should be a oneWay street (optional) : limit the search to the street that are one way street. If you use a checkbox in a form to indent the results, the value will be 'on' or 'off', so to simplify the use : the value for the web service can be 'true' or 'on'

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: Whether (or not) we want the distance field to be output. This option is useful to improve the performance if we don't care about the distance (e.g : we search for name). Of course, the results won't be sorted by distance. If you use a checkbox in a form to indent the results, the value will be 'on' or 'off', so to simplify the use : the value for the web service can be 'true' or 'on'

parameters.name: streettype
parameters.description: filter search with a stret type

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The first pagination index. Numbered from 1. If the number is < 1 or not specified, it will be set to the default value : 1

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The last pagination index. if < 1 or not specified, it will be set to startindex + 10. Max = 10 (can be changed)

POBox.description: Post office box, Boite postale, Casilla de Correo,...

POBoxAgency.description: Agency where the office box, Boite postale, Casilla de Correo is

POBoxInfo.description: extra info on post office box, Boite postale, Casilla de Correo,..

block.description: The block in an address (Brasilia only) the block in austria, singapore,... address

city.description: The city or locality, a small town or village name sometimes is included in an address when the Delivery Point is outside the boundary of the main Post Town that serves it.

citySubdivision.description: A sub division of a city

civicNumberSuffix.description: The number that follows the house number (Canada only)

confidence.description: An indicator that mesure how the parser is confident for the result

countrycode.description: The countrycode given in the request

dependentLocality.description: 'Sub' city atached to a big city

distance.description: The distance of the address for the given parameter location in the query

district.description: The district, mainly use for Russia

extraInfo.description: Informations on floor, unit, and sometimes POBOX,...

floor.description: The floor in an address, not a floor number in a unit (Brasilia only)

houseNumber.description: Official number assigned to an address by the municipality, several languages supported

houseNumberInfo.description: All information that give extra information on the house number

id.description: An internal ID to identify the address

name.description: Name of the place, it is null in case of address but filled if common place. Name is different than recipient name

postDirection.description: The cardinal direction after the name of the street

postDirectionIntersection.description: The cardinal direction after the name of the intersection street

postTown.description: a city is a required part of all postal addresses in the United Kingdom

preDirection.description: The cardinal direction before the name of the street

preDirectionIntersection.description: The cardinal direction before the name of the intersection street

quadrant.description: The quadrant in an address (Brasilia only)

quarter.description: A section of an urban settlement

recipientName.description: Name of the organisation or person at the given address

sector.description: The sector in an address (Brasilia only)

state.description: The state or county when applicable, can be fullname or abbreviation

streetName.description: The official name of the street or the ordinal number

streetNameIntersection.description: The official name of the intersection street

streetTypeIntersection.description: The type of the intersection street

suiteNumber.description: Informations on the unit, mainly used and filled by standardizer

suiteType.description: Informations on the unit, mainly used and filled by standardizer

maxScore.description: the max score value accross all the results found

numFound.description: how many results were found whatever the pagination

QTime.description: The execution time of the query in ms

error.description: A String only present if an error occured (e.g : empty Latitude or longitude)

numFound.description: The number of results display with this query (it takes the pagination into account)

adm1Code.description: The internal code for the administrative division of level 1

adm1Name.description: The name of the administrative division of level 1

adm2Code.description: The internal code for the administrative division of level 2

adm2Name.description: The name of the administrative division of level 2

adm3Code.description: The internal code for the administrative division of level 3

adm3Name.description: The name of the administrative division of level 3

adm4Code.description: The internal code for the administrative division of level 4

adm4Name.description: The name of the administrative division of level 4

adm5Code.description: The internal code for the administrative division of level 5

adm5Name.description: The name of the administrative division of level 5

amenity.description: Informations on category of OpenStreetMap POIs

asciiName.description: The ASCII name of the feature

country_flag_url.description: The relative URL to get the country flag image

currencyCode.description: The Currency code (ISO_4217) of the country

currencyName.description: The Currency name of the country

distance.description: The distance beetween the point and the gisFeature in meters

equivalentFipsCode.description: The fips Code of the country when no code are available

featureId.description: A unique id that identify the feature

fipsCode.description: The fips Code of the country

google_map_url.description: The URL to get the location on Google Map

gtopo30.description: Average elevation of 30'x30' (ca 900mx900m) area in meters

isIn.description: Information of the city where the street / POI is (depends on openstreetmap 'is_in' field), the city in general (only for placetype street)

isInAdm.description: Information of the administration division where the street / POI is.

isInPlace.description: Information of the place where the street / POI is (quarter, common place). Generally a place at a lower level than city

isInZip.description: Information of the zipcode where the street / POI is"

iso3166Alpha2Code.description: The iso 3166 Alpha 2 code of the country

iso3166Alpha3Code.description: The iso 3166 Alpha 3 code of the country

iso3166NumericCode.description: The iso 3166 numeric code of the country

level.description: The level of the Administrative division (1-5)

oneWay.description: Wether the street is oneway or not

openstreetmapId.description: the id of the openstreetmap element

openstreetmap_map_url.description: The URL to get the location on Openstreetmap Map

phonePrefix.description: The phone prefix of the country

placeType.description: The Type of Feature see faq

population.description: How many people lives in this feature

postalCodeMask.description: The mask that all postal code of the country matches

postalCodeRegex.description: The regexp that all zipcode/postalcode of the country matches

tld.description: top-level domain name, (last part of an Internet domain name) of the country

yahoo_map_url.description: The URL to get the location on Yahoo Map

zipCodes.description: The zipcodes (only for city and city subdivision), one node by zipcode

adm1_code.description: The internal code for the administrative division of level 1

adm1_name.description: The name of the administrative division of level 1

adm1_names_alternate.description: The alternate names of the administrative division of level 1 without specific language code

adm2_code.description: The internal code for the administrative division of level 2

adm2_name.description: The name of the administrative division of level 2

adm2_names_alternate.description: The alternate names of the administrative division of level 2 without specific language code

adm3_code.description: The internal code for the administrative division of level 3

adm3_name.description: The name of the administrative division of level 3

adm4_code.description: The internal code for the administrative division of level 4

adm4_name.description: The name of the administrative division of level 4

amenity.description: Informations on category of OpenStreetMap POIs

area.description: Area of the country in m² (only for country placetype)

capital_name.description: Name of the capital of the country(only for country placetype)

continent.description: The continent the country belongs (only for country placetype)

country_flag_url.description: The relative URL to get the country flag image

country_name.description: The name of the country the features belongs to

country_names_alternate.description: The alternate names of the country without specific language code

currency_code.description: The ISO 4217 Currency from the curencycode (only for country placetype)

currency_name.description: The name of the currency of the country (only for country placetype)

feature_id.description: A unique id that identify the feature

fips_code.description: The FIPS Code of the country (only for country placetype)

fully_qualified_name.description: A name of the form : (adm1Name et adm2Name are printed) Paris, Département de Ville-De-Paris, Ile-De-France, (FR)

google_map_url.description: The URL to get the location on Google Map

gtopo30.description: Average elevation of 30'x30' (ca 900mx900m) area in meters

house_numbers.description: a list of all the house numbers sorted and their coordinates (only for placetype street)

is_in.description: Information on the city where the street / POI is (depends on OpenStreetMap 'is_in' field), the city in general (only for placetype street)

is_in_adm.description: Information of the administration division where the street / POI is.

is_in_place.description: Information on the place where the street / POI is (quater, common place). Generally a place at a lower level than city

is_in_zip.description: Information of the zipcode where the street / POI is (often fill for placetype street)

isoalpha2_country_code.description: The ISO 3166 alpha 2 code of the country (only for country placetype)

isoalpha3_country_code.description: The ISO 3166 alpha 3 code of the country (only for country placetype)

length.description: The length of the street (only for placetype street)

level.description: Level of the Adm 1 , 2, 3, or 4(only for Adm placetype)

municipality.description: if the place is a municipality. it is usefull for geonames feature that don't have concept of 'city' but a populated place (that can be a quarter)

name_alternates.description: The alternate names of the feature that without specific language code

one_way.description: whether the street is one way or not (only for placetype street)

openstreetmap_id.description: The OpenStreetMap unique id of the street (only for placetype street)

openstreetmap_map_url.description: The URL to get the location on OpenStreetMap.org

phone_prefix.description: The phone prefix of the country. e.g : +33 .(only for country placetype)

placetype.description: The place Type of the Feature

population.description: How many people live in this feature

postal_code_mask.description: The mask that postal codes should verify. e.g : ##### (only for country placetype)

postal_code_regex.description: The regular expression that postal codes should verify (only for country placetype)

score.description: a number that indicates the relevance of the result

spoken_languages.description: List of languages spoken in the country (only for country placetype)

street_type.description: The type of the street (only for placetype street)

tld.description: Top level domain of the country (only for country placetype)

yahoo_map_url.description: The URL to get the location on Yahoo Map

distance.description: The distance between the point and the nearest point to the street in meters

gid.description: Unique id of the street, it is unique between GeoNames and OpenStreetMap

isIn.description: Information on the city where the street is (depends on OpenStreetMap 'is_in' field), the city in general

isInAdm.description: Information of the administration division where the street is.

isInPlace.description: Information on the place where the street is (quater, common place). Generally a place at a lower level than city

isInZip.description: Information of the zipcode where the street / POI is (often fill for placetype street)

lat.description: The latitude of the middle of the street(north-south)

length.description: length of the street in meters

lng.description: The longitude of the middle of the street(east-west)

oneWay.description: Whether the street is a one way street or not

openstreetmapId.description: OpenStreetMap unique id of the street

streetType.description: The type of the street (see street type list)

QTime.description: The execution time of the query in ms

error.description: A String only present if an error occured (e.g : empty Latitude or longitude)

numFound.description: The number of results display with this query (it takes the pagination into account)
